definition: to sublimate/sublimation (physics)/to raise to a higher level/to refine/promotion
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua

sentences.english: The question is sort of, what is sublimation?
sentences.chinese: 这个问题其实在问什么是升华？

sentences.english: We are witnessing the last edifying moments of a transcendent being.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们看到的就是生命完成升华的那一刻。

sentences.english: Art is the distillation of life.
sentences.chinese: 艺术是现实生活的升华。

sentences.english: Luleng deems that public will is a sublimation of human's free volitions .
sentences.chinese: 卢梭认为，公意就是人类自由意志的升华。

sentences.english: In heat transfer experiment, the calorie comparison theory and naphthalene sublimation technology are adopted.
sentences.chinese: 在传热实验中，采用了热质比拟原理及萘升华技术。

sentences.english: It is very powerful to sublimate the malefic effects of Saturn .
sentences.chinese: 这是非常强大的升华土星的邪恶的影响。

sentences.english: These three aspects function together to promote the sublimation of the village approval consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 这三者共同作用，促成村庄认同意识的升华。

sentences.english: Does that make it sort of a subgroup of displacement?
sentences.chinese: 升华是否属于移置的一种形式？

sentences.english: The erotic impulse is sublimated into art.
And, you can make their own personal ideological realm has been sublimated .
sentences.chinese: 并且，可以让自己的个人思想境界得到升华。

sentences.english: Carries the memory of history, this is the red security spiritual sublimation.
sentences.chinese: 承载着历史的记忆，这是红安精神的升华。

sentences.english: You need to begin connecting to other Hearts in order to get the upgrades.
sentences.chinese: 你还需要与其他的心相结连，才能升华。

sentences.english: However, Edmund Burke and Kant provided classic studies of the difference between beauty and the sublime.
sentences.chinese: 然而，伯克与康德作出了美与升华的古典研究。

sentences.english: Romance is a heightened sense of reality.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫是真实生活感觉的升华。

sentences.english: Their affection to each other was sublimated into a lasting friendship.
sentences.chinese: 他俩之间的感情被升华成一种永久的友谊。

sentences.english: Its sublimation temperature is as high as 3650℃, which can increase the cathode lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 升华高温延长了阴极的使用寿命。

definition: a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
to stand aloof/to be detached from/to transcend worldliness/untrammeled/unconventional
